sen.j: ナイフ形石器（ナイフがた せっき）とは、後期旧石器時代に特徴的な、石刃（刃器）などの剥片に刃潰し剥離（剥片自身がもつ鋭い側縁の一部をナイフの刃のように残し、ほかの側縁を鈍くつぶす調整剥離）を加え、現在のナイフに似た形に仕上げた石器である。
sen.e: Stone tools resembling a knife are characteristics to the end period of the Paleolithic Period, and they were made by blunting and exfoliating flakes like stone knives (blades) (i.e. exfoliation was adjusted so that the sharp edge of flake would be partly remained like a knife blade and the rest of the edge would be blunted), and by forming the flakes into a shape similar to modern knives.
sen.cmt: 刃潰し剥離: blunting and exfoliating（定訳はないようです）
sen.e: Stone tools resembling a knife were characteristics to the end period of the Paleolithic period, and they were made by blunting and exfoliating flakes like stone knives (blades) (i.e. Exfoliation was adjusted so that the sharp edge of flake would be partly remained like a knife blade and the rest of the edge would be blunted), and by forming the flakes into a shape similar to modern knives.

Stone tools resembling a knife were characteristics to the end period of the Paleolithic period, and they were made by blunting and exfoliating flakes like stone knives (blades) (i.e. Exfoliation was adjusted so that the sharp edge of flake would be partly remained like a knife blade and the rest of the edge would be blunted), and by forming the flakes into a shape similar to modern knives.

sen.j: 海外では先端の尖ったナイフ形石器を尖頭器に含んで扱うことが多いが、日本では両刃の槍先形尖頭器とは区別して片刃の利器をナイフ形石器と呼称する。
sen.e: Sharp-ended stone tools resembling a knife are often categorized as point in abroad, however, in Japan they are separated from double-edged spear points and only single-edged tools are referred as stone tools resembling a knife.

Sharp-ended stone tools resembling a knife are often categorized as point in abroad, however, in Japan they are separated from double-edged spear points and only single-edged tools are referred as stone tools resembling a knife.

Sharp-ended stone tools resembling a knife are often categorized as point in abroad, however, in Japan they are separated from double-edged spear points and only single-edged tools are referred as stone tools resembling a knife.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 石刃技法の普遍化とともに現れる石器であり、切り出し小刀のように鋭い刃と先端をもつ突刺形のナイフ形石器とカッターナイフにも似た切截形のナイフ形石器とがある。
sen.e: Stone tools resembling a knife appeared in accordance with the generalization of stone knife techniques, and there are piercing type with sharp blade and edge like a small cutting knife and cutting type like a box cutter.

Stone tools resembling a knife appeared in accordance with the generalization of stone knife techniques, and there are piercing type with sharp blade and edge like a small cutting knife and cutting type like a box cutter.

Stone tools resembling a knife appeared in accordance with the generalization of stone knife techniques, and there are piercing type with sharp blade and edge like a small cutting knife and cutting type like a box cutter.

sen.j: 前者の一部には槍先などの狩猟具もあったが、後者はそのほとんどは加工具として使用された。
sen.e: The former type included hunting tools like spear head, and the most of the latter type were used as working tools.
The former type included hunting tools like spear head, and the most of the latter type were used as working tools.
The former type included hunting tools like spear head, and the most of the latter type were used as working tools.

sen.j: 毛皮や肉、樹皮などを切るために用いられ、磨製石器の刃よりも格段に鋭利であった。
sen.e: They were used to cut fur, meat or bark, and much sharper than the blade of ground stoneware.
They were used to cut fur, meat or bark, and much sharper than the blade of ground stoneware.
They were used to cut fur, meat or bark, and much sharper than the blade of ground stoneware.

sen.j: ナイフ形石器は、日本列島で独自に発達したものであって、アジア大陸ではみられない。
sen.e: Stone tools resembling a knife were developed uniquely in the Japanese Islands and have not been found in the Asian Continent.
Stone tools resembling a knife were developed uniquely in the Japanese Islands and have not been found in the Asian Continent.
Stone tools resembling a knife were developed uniquely in the Japanese Islands and have not been found in the Asian Continent.

sen.j: しかし、ナイフ形石器の一種である剥片尖頭器が九州から朝鮮半島にかけてみられる。
sen.e: However, flake points (a kind of stone tools resembling a knife) have been found in areas from Kyushu to the Korean Peninsula.
However, flake points (a kind of stone tool resembling a knife) have been found in areas from Kyushu to the Korean Peninsula.
However, flake points (a kind of stone tool resembling a knife) have been found in areas from Kyushu to the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: この石器群が、主に生産活動に使用された時期を「ナイフ形石器文化期」とも呼ばれ、3万年前頃から1.4万年前頃まで存続する。
sen.e: The period when these stone tools were mainly used for production activities is called "cultural period of stone tools resembling a knife", which lasted from 30,000 to 14,000 years ago.
The period when these stone tools were mainly used for production activities is called 'cultural period of stone tools resembling a knife,' which lasted from 30,000 to 14,000 years ago.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を変えました。
sen.e: The period when these stone tools were mainly used for production activities is called 'cultural period of stone tools resembling a knife,' which lasted from 30,000 to 14,000 years ago.

sen.j: なお、この文化期の終わり頃の1.5年前かやや遡る頃になると、関東・中部地方を中心に槍先形尖頭器の石槍が現れた。
sen.e: At the end of this cultural period (1.5 year ago or before), spear points appeared around Kanto and Chubu region.
sen.cmt: 「1.5年前」は、「1.5万年前(15,000 years ago)」の間違いかと思いますが、原文の通り訳しています。
sen.e: At the end of this cultural period (1.5 year ago or before), stone spear points appeared around Kanto and Chubu region.
sen.cmt: ウェブでも「1.5年前」となっているため、原文通りとしています。
sen.e: At the end of this cultural period (1.5 year ago or before), stone spear points appeared around Kanto and Chubu region.

sen.j: ナイフ形石器を凌駕するようになった。
sen.e: Eventually these spear points surpassed stone tools resembling a knife.
Eventually they surpassed stone tools resembling a knife.
Eventually they surpassed stone tools resembling a knife.

sen.j: ナイフ形石器は、製作・使用された時期や地域、素材となった剥片の性質、刃潰し剥離が施された部位、あるいは全体の形の違いなどから、下記のような型式に区分される。
sen.e: Stone tools resembling a knife are categorized into the following types according to the period or region that they were made or used, the nature of the materials of flake, the parts blunted and exfoliated, or the difference of overall shapes.

Stone tools resembling a knife are categorized into the following types according to the period or region that they were made or used, the nature of the materials of flake, the parts blunted and exfoliated, or the difference of overall shapes.

Stone tools resembling a knife are categorized into the following types according to the period or region that they were made or used, the nature of the materials of flake, the parts blunted and exfoliated, or the difference of overall shapes.
Higashiyama type - Tohoku region
Higashiyama type: Tohoku region
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: Higashiyama type: Tohoku region

sen.j: 杉久保型－縦型石刃の先端部及び基部への刃潰し加工－主に中部地方北部から東北地方にかけて分布
sen.e: Sugikubo type - vertical stone knife which top-end and base is blunted - distributed mainly from the northern part of Chubu region to Tohoku region
Sugikubo type: Vertical stone knife which top-end and base is blunted; distributed mainly from the northern part of Chubu region to Tohoku region
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: Sugikubo type: Vertical stone knife which top-end and base is blunted; distributed mainly from the northern part of Chubu region to Tohoku region

sen.j: 茂呂（もろ）型－一縦型石刃の側縁と反対側基部への刃潰し加工－主に関東、中部地方南部、東海に分布
sen.e: Moro type - vertical stone knife which edge and the base of the opposite side is blunted - distributed mainly in Kanto region, the southern part of Chubu region and Tokai region
sen.cmt: 「一縦型」は「縦型」と解釈しました。
sen.e: Moro type: Vertical stone knife which edge and the base of the opposite side is blunted; distributed mainly in Kanto region, the southern part of Chubu region and Tokai region
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: Moro type: Vertical stone knife which edge and the base of the opposite side is blunted; distributed mainly in Kanto region, the southern part of Chubu region and Tokai region

sen.j: 国府（こう）型－横型石刃（翼状剥片）の一側縁への刃潰し加工－主に瀬戸内、関西、中国、四国に分布
sen.e: Ko type - horizontal stone knife (wing-shaped flake) which has one blunted edge - distributed mainly in Setouchi, Kansai, Chugoku and Shikoku region
Ko type: Horizontal stone knife (wing-shaped flake) which has one blunted edge; distributed mainly in Setouchi, Kansai, Chugoku and Shikoku regions
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: Ko type: Horizontal stone knife (wing-shaped flake) which has one blunted edge; distributed mainly in Setouchi, Kansai, Chugoku and Shikoku regions

sen.j: 九州型－基本的に茂呂型と同じであるが小型－九州に分布
sen.e: Kyushu type - basically same as Moro type, but smaller - distributed in Kyushu region
Kyushu type: Basically same as Moro type, but smaller; distributed in Kyushu region
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: Kyushu type: Basically same as Moro type, but smaller; distributed in Kyushu region

sen.j: なお、北海道にも検出例が増えてきている。
sen.e: In addition, increasing number of samples has been discovered in Hokkaido region.
In addition, increasing number of samples has been discovered in Hokkaido Prefecture.
In addition, increasing number of samples has been discovered in Hokkaido Prefecture.

sen.j: こうした地域差が、姶良Tn火山灰降灰以前に形成されていた証拠が各地で知られるようになってきた。
sen.e: There have been evidences in various places that shows these regional differences were formed before Aira-Tn ash fall.
There have been evidences in various places that show these regional differences were formed before Aira-Tn ash fall.
There have been evidences in various places that show these regional differences were formed before Aira-Tn ash fall.

sen.j: また、旧石器時代の時期区分や文化の発展段階を検討するうえで、尖頭器や細石器と並んで重要な役割を果たしている。
sen.e: In addition, stone tools resembling a knife play a key part to examine the time division and the cultural development stages of the Paleolithic period, along with points and microliths.
In addition, stone tools resembling a knife play a key part to examine the time division and the cultural development stages of the Paleolithic period, along with points and microliths.
In addition, stone tools resembling a knife play a key part to examine the time division and the cultural development stages of the Paleolithic period, along with points and microliths.
